intro: Acronychia similaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sand-fig, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
